intro: Boehmeria longispica var. heterodonta, commonly known as the hairy nettle, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of nettle. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. This variant is notable for its unique morphological features and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
